target_audience.primary_persona: Developers and technical teams who want to visually manage and execute Claude AI agents without CLI complexity
secondary_personas: AI/ML engineers building agent-based automation workflows
DevOps teams setting up AI-powered tooling and integrations
Technical product managers overseeing AI agent deployments
Solo developers exploring Claude API capabilities
pain_points: Managing multiple Claude agents via CLI is cumbersome and error-prone
No visual overview of agent configurations, skills, and MCP server integrations
Difficulty tracking which skills are used by which agents
MCP server configuration and testing requires manual JSON editing
No real-time visibility into agent execution and streaming outputs
Setting up agent workflows requires deep technical knowledge
goals: Quickly create, configure, and execute Claude agents through a visual interface
Manage reusable skills and track their usage across agents
Connect and test MCP servers with minimal configuration effort
Build automated workflows using visual flow editors
Monitor agent executions in real-time with streaming output
Reduce time-to-value when working with Claude AI
target_audience.usage_context: Used as a self-hosted web application for local or team-based AI agent development and management, typically during development and production monitoring phases

product_vision.one_liner: A comprehensive web-based management interface for Claude agents, skills, and MCP servers with visual workflow automation
product_vision.problem_statement: Managing Claude AI agents, their skills, and MCP server integrations through CLI and config files is time-consuming, error-prone, and lacks visibility into agent behavior and execution
product_vision.value_proposition: Claude Agent UI provides a unified visual dashboard for creating, configuring, executing, and monitoring Claude agents with real-time streaming output, skill management, MCP server integration, and visual workflow automation - all without touching the command line
success_metrics: Time reduction in agent setup and configuration
Number of agents and skills successfully managed
User adoption and active usage frequency
Reduction in configuration errors vs CLI

existing_features: Agent CRUD operations with visual editor
AI-powered agent creation via chat interface
Agent execution with real-time SSE streaming output
Skill management with YAML frontmatter support
MCP server management (add, edit, delete, test, import/export)
Multi-transport MCP support (stdio, SDK, SSE, HTTP)
Visual flow editor with React Flow for workflow automation
